name: Sweet potato steaks
description: Recipe video above. I know the ingredients looks exorbitantly long for something I describe as "an easy way to turn sweet potatoes into a really tasty meaty dinner"! But actually, it is very straight forward. Thick slices of sweet potato roasted with a simple spice mix, then served on a bed of tahini yogurt topped with a glitter of garlic-sesame-chilli and pine nuts. It's a fabulous flavour combination!Serve with something crunchy - toasted pita bread is my pick. (Note 5)
recipeIngredient: 1  gigantic sweet potato - to cut 2 x “steaks”  (1.8 cm thick, 17 cm long, 7 cm wide (0.7 x 6.5 x 2.75") - Note 1)
1/2 tsp onion powder ((or more garlic powder))
1/2 tsp garlic powder ((or more onion powder))
1 tbsp red cayenne pepper (, deseeded, finely chopped (not spicy, Note 4))
1 tbsp green cayenne pepper (, deseeded, finely chopped (not spicy, Note 4))

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F (180°C fan-forced). Line a tray with parchment/baking paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F (180°C fan-forced). Line a tray with parchment/baking paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake sweet potato - Rub sweet potato steaks with oil, then sprinkle each side evenly with spice mix (don’t rub, it smears). Bake 45 - 50 minutes until potato is soft. Don’t flip.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake sweet potato - Rub sweet potato steaks with oil, then sprinkle each side evenly with spice mix (don’t rub, it smears). Bake 45 - 50 minutes until potato is soft. Don’t flip.

recipeInstructions.text: Tahini yogurt sauce - Whisk ingredients in a medium heat-proof bowl until mostly combined. Microwave for 20 seconds on high. Whisk again - it will be like softly whipped cream! Use warm or at room temp.
recipeInstructions.name: Tahini yogurt sauce - Whisk ingredients in a medium heat-proof bowl until mostly combined. Microwave for 20 seconds on high. Whisk again - it will be like softly whipped cream! Use warm or at room temp.

recipeInstructions.text: Toast pine nuts in a small pan (no oil) preheated over medium heat. Once lightly golden, remove into a bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Toast pine nuts in a small pan (no oil) preheated over medium heat. Once lightly golden, remove into a bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Topping - In the same pan, heat oil (still on medium). Add all Topping ingredients and cook, stirring, until the garlic is golden. Transfer into a bowl immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Topping - In the same pan, heat oil (still on medium). Add all Topping ingredients and cook, stirring, until the garlic is golden. Transfer into a bowl immediately.

recipeInstructions.text: Assemble - Smear most of the yogurt sauce on plate (save some for drizzling). Put sweet potato on top. Sprinkle with Topping, drizzle with yogurt sauce, then sprinkle with pine nuts, coriander and sumac. EAT with crunchy toasted flatbread!
recipeInstructions.name: Assemble - Smear most of the yogurt sauce on plate (save some for drizzling). Put sweet potato on top. Sprinkle with Topping, drizzle with yogurt sauce, then sprinkle with pine nuts, coriander and sumac. EAT with crunchy toasted flatbread!

review.reviewBody: This was absolutely delicious and I served it with your "my favourite avocado salad" and it was a perfect match!! Thank you for soooo many delicious recipes for all of our family, which includes vegetarians and carnivores!!

So very wonderful.  My husband didn't come up until all was gone. I followed your recipe exactly, except for using jalapeños instead of cayenne peppers since it's all I could find. Thank you, again, Nagi. You rock!
OMG.  This is a showstopper. Spectacular.  Friend just said it was if it was served up at Bennelong.

Holy moley. I got some fat ones today for this recipe at 2.50 Aud kg. Cuttings getting ready to plant up when the soil a bit warmer. Easy to grow.
Made last week. This is going to present regularly.

Incredible recipe! Even won over my hubby who doesn't typically like sweet potato or yoghurt. 
Thanks for this amazing vego recipe Nagi ♥️ Love your work.
Absolutely delicious! I just made this for lunch and will definitely be making it again. Couldn’t get Cayenne peppers so swapped for roasted capsicum and some crushed chilli

keywords: sweet potato recipe, sweet potato steaks
